taxon_name.authority: (Tuckerman ex Mackenzie) Mackenzie in N. L. Britton et al.

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family cyperaceae;genus carex;section deweyanae;species bromoides;subspecies bromoides

bio:treatment.description: Plants densely to loosely cespitose. Rhizomes short to long, internodes 0.2–20 mm. Culms 0.5–1(–1.1) mm wide. Widest leaf blades 1.3–2.9(–3.1) mm wide. Longest inflorescences (33–)40–63(–71) mm. Perigynium beak 0.3–0.42 times as long as perigynium. 2n = 64, 66, 68.
Forested flood plains, wet hardwood forests, hardwood swamps, occasionally wet meadows, marsh edges;

N.B., N.S., Ont., Que.; Ala., Ark., Conn., D.C., Del., Fla., Ga., Ill., Ind., Ky., La., Maine, Md., Mass., Mich., Minn., Miss., Mo., N.H., N.J., N.Y., N.C., Ohio, Pa., R.I., S.C., Tenn., Tex., Vt., Va., W.Va., Wis.; c Mexico.
